reviews.review_msg: Arne is passionate about what he teaches, so he really makes you think and expects you to know the material/textbook inside out. Weekly quizzes were a bit too specific, but not horrible. Lecture material is alright, only thing is he speaks too fast and you need to show up to class. NEED to understand the textbook topics in order to do well.

Under no circumstances take courses with it, no office hours, insane reading, brutally difficult exams no one did well in, inaccurate learning objectives,rude when asked questions, NOT clear grading criteria since he cranked up the grading scale to 95+ AFTER he released the grades. This man expects way to much for his poor teaching and attitude.

Dr. Mooers is an excellent professor; lectures are engaging and it is clear that he is passionate about the class topics. Exams are difficult but not unreasonable. The class requires lots of studying with weekly quizzes, 3 exams, and a few projects, but overall is very interesting, and Dr. Mooers does a good job of explaining concepts.

Sometimes people should just stick to research.... His course takes half the workload of the semester and his exams are out of the world, like truly out of the world. There is absolutely no way you can do good on them. Also there is no scaling. It's sad that his course is a monopoly. DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM

Rude and condescending when you ask him questions as if he gets offended. The course takes up half your workload and he does not have office hours. Lots of readings that don't help with the understanding. Material is all over the place and no source of practice or homework. Avoid at all costs

Lectures were kind of dull but they weren't recorded so you really had to pay attention and he kind of mumbles and trails off halfway through sentences. The textbook also doesn't really help if you're trying to understand concepts. His test questions are also really hard to understand. Also weekly quizzes... good luck.

3 midterms, weekly quizzes (7 total), 2 projects, each lecture had 60+ slides and this class covered 2+ textbook chapters weekly. The prof changed the last midterm date so he could extend a trip - the alternative was a cumulative exam during exam week. He's nice, passionate, and has interesting classes but this class is a time monopolizer.

Weekly quizzes, 4 projects, 3 midterms (no final). Insane work load. No office hours. Test avg always a fail & doesn't scale. Threw everything at the one TA for marking, & when he finally marked one test Q, his 11 y.o. daughter marked it wrong & the TA had to fix all the exams. Completely useless prof. Very rude/condescending when u ask for help

This class was awful. Arne had so many assignments due worth 5-10% each but took way too much work, some assignments were just weird and useless, and he was honestly not the nicest person. He could be condescending when you ask simple questions and spoke like you're at a bloody auction (too fast!). 3 Midterms were 10% each and ridiculously hard :(
Awesome evolution prof. Tests could be tricky but grading was lax.

Arne is very passionate about the topics he teaches. I would recommend listening to the lectures since he talks fast. The midterms were conceptual and difficult. They were also very lengthy. The group work and quizzes were fair.

Dr. Mooers is definitely passionate about what he does. If you want to learn about how vast and interesting the field of evolutionary biology is, take BISC 300 with him - he includes lots of current research into his lectures. My only real criticism - he talks very fast and maybe tries to incorporate too much information into each lecture.

Very interesting lectures, talks fast but lectures are recorded so you can replay if needed. Great prof personality wise, he's not an expert in all topics covered in the course though. 3 Midterms and no final. One quiz every week. One group project in tutorial involving a presentation and creation of a podcast, would take his class again. :)

Okay so he's a decent professor but I wouldn't give him a 4.4 rating I'd say more like 3.6. I've definitley seen more dedicated and passionate profs, not that he isn't but in comparisson he is basically just a regular professor. I advise you ask for lots of help and go into more detail than he asks for when using formulas and you'll be fine.
Fair professor. Fair exams. However,I did not like that the final had fifteen marks dedicated to a lecture that he barely taught us two days prior.

3 midterms, 1 project(with presentation), and no final. However, his exams are EXTREMELY hard. Thank god we had awesome TA's who marked leniently. He speaks really fast in class so you have to pay attention. Tons of material to learn (2-3 chapters a week) + class notes. He makes things interesting, but I think gives way too much work.

Really good prof, talks pretty fast so try to convince him to record his lectures (helps to go back and review) he is really flexible about course format (we had 3 midterms and 3 assignments and no final) his tests were really conceptual and hard but hey, its not first year anymore kids! anyway if your serious about science take his courses.
Super interesting lecturer. His notes are ok but they often need to be supplemented with material from the textbook. His assignments (3) are challenging but his exams are fair.
I loved his lectures. He really inspires one to learn and be successful. Highly recommended for all the courses he teaches. He knows a lot of stuff other than just science/biology. A very smart guy.

awesome prof! had high interest in the subject and made sure you did too by the end of the semester. seriously learned lots and enjoyed the classwork. exams are tough but scaled. presentations also boosted course grade quite a bit. recommended!!

AWESOME.  Great lecturer, very helpful.  He actually learned most of the class's names!  I couldn't believe it.
 
 Loves his field, and makes you love it too.  Not too difficult.  Average was a C+/B-.
